member_organisations: Danmarks Jægerforbund (Danish Hunters' Association - www.jaegerforbundet.dk ) - Finlands Jägareförbund - Suomen Metsästäjäliitto (Finnish Hunters' Association - www.metsastajaliitto.fi ) - Norges Jeger- og Fiskerforbund (Norwegian Association of Hunters and Anglers - www.njff.no ) - Skotveiðifélag Íslands (Icelandic Hunters’ Association - www.skotvis.is ) - Svenska Jägareförbundet (Swedish Association for Hunting and Wildlife Management - www.jagareforbundet.se ) - Jägarnas Riksförbund (Swedish National Association of Huntsmen - www.jagarnasriksforbund.se ) - Ålandsøernes jagtvårdsföreninger (Aaland Islands' Hunting Associations)
fields_of_interest: Agriculture, Trade, Culture, Environment, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Public Health, Food Safety
eu_initiatives: EU and international policy and legislative files concerning hunting and wildlife management, such as the EU nature directives, rules on firearms and ammunition, animal welfare and health, CAP, invasive alien species, trapping, and wildlife trade.
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
membership:
Federation of Associations for Hunting and Conservation of the EU (FACE) - www.face.eu 
 
International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN) - www.iucn.org
goals__remit: Nordisk Jægersamvirke / Nordic Hunters’ Alliance (NJS) is a non-profit organisation representing approximately 600,000 hunters and shooters in Sweden, Norway, Finland, Denmark and Iceland. NJA promotes the Nordic hunting tradition and ethics as a sustainable model in European hunting and wildlife management.
